posts.name: csos
posts.cooked:
hello, when trying to run a path with pathplanner, the wheels start to get stuck, they go back and forth and get stuck and almost damage the motors.

I will share the configs and codes with you, I would be very happy if you can help me.

getPose :

resetOdometry :

getChassisSpeeds :

driveRobotRelative :

Pathplanner settings:

image 827×563 24.3 KB image 814×559 23.9 KB image 819×552 10.5 KB

image 827×563 24.3 KB

image 827×563 24.3 KB

image 814×559 23.9 KB

image 814×559 23.9 KB

image 819×552 10.5 KB

image 819×552 10.5 KB

There is no problem in the teleop phase, the robot goes smoothly, it just gets stuck when you try to follow the path in autonomous

We use the MK4I L2 module and 2 NEO motors for Drive And Rot

not : My config is correctly pulled from the GUI and there are no problems with the teleop on the drive.

pls help

posts.name: Eyup Akgun
posts.cooked: Is there a video about the problem?

posts.name: csos
posts.cooked: Hello, here is the related video: https://streamable.com/pa4z9t

posts.name: Kyle Burman
posts.cooked: What’s the path look like that your running?

posts.name: csos
posts.cooked: path like this just for testing.

posts.name: Kyle Burman
posts.cooked:
Try running it on the ground because pathplanner knows that your robot isn’t moving and that could be the issue

Try replacing the PID loops that you have in pathplanner with your settings (I don’t have a good explanation for this just something to try)

posts.name: csos
posts.cooked: hello first of all thanks for your help, we will try to lower the PID , I tried the value of 0.09 while I was posting this post but nothing changed much. I will lower the PID value to 0.002 and try this value. In 1 day I will share what we tried again.

posts.name: csos
posts.cooked:
Hello again, we found the source of the problem. We forgot velocityConversionFactor when migrating the code from REVLib 2024 to REVLib 2025

related code :

config.encoder.velocityConversionFactor(SwerveConstants.driveConversionVelocityFactor);

our problem is solved in this way. thank you again

accepted_answer.excerpt:
Hello again, we found the source of the problem. We forgot velocityConversionFactor when migrating the code from REVLib 2024 to REVLib 2025 
related code : 
config.encoder.velocityConversionFactor(SwerveConstants.driveConversionVelocityFactor); 
our problem is solved in this way. thank you again
